alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Collingsworth; Donley; Gray; Hemphill; Hutchinson; Roberts; Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 08 at 2:28AM CDT until April 09 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR CENTRAL AND EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE COMBINED TEXAS AND OKLAHOMA PANHANDLES... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN AND SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * Affected Area...In Texas...Hutchinson...Roberts...Hemphill... Carson...Gray...Wheeler...Armstrong...Donley and Collingsworth. * 20 Foot Winds...Northwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph today. Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph on Saturday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 10 percent today. As low as 6 percent on Saturday * Red Flag Threat Index...2 to 3 today. 4 to 5 on Saturday. * Timing...From Noon through 8 PM today. From noon to 7 PM on Saturday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
